intro: Nycteranthus herbertii, commonly known as the night-flowering morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces small, dark blue or purple berries that contain the seeds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Nycteranthus herbertii is typically found in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade.
